meanings.sent1: She loves to twirl around in her pretty dress.
meanings.sent2: The ballerina will twirl gracefully on stage.
meanings.sent3: The little girl would twirl happily in the park.
meanings.sent4: The colorful umbrella twirls in the wind like a pinwheel.
meanings.sent5: The top will twirl faster if you spin it harder.

meanings.sent1: The ice skater performed a perfect twirl on the ice.
meanings.sent2: The twirl of the tornado was both frightening and fascinating.
meanings.sent3: The twirl of the dancer's skirt caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent4: The twirl of the carousel made the children giggle with joy.
meanings.sent5: The twirl of the lollipop made it look like a colorful whirligig.

meanings.definition: To twist or wind around something
meanings.sent1: She would twirl her hair absentmindedly while reading.
meanings.sent2: The snake will twirl around the tree branch to climb up.
meanings.sent3: He tried to twirl the spaghetti around his fork but it kept slipping.
meanings.sent4: The vines twirl around the old stone columns in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The ribbon will twirl beautifully around the gift box.
